alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 11:23PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coffey and southeastern Lyon Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1122 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Neosho Rapids to 5 miles southeast of Gridley to 9 miles northwest of Yates Center. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burlington, New Strawn, Hartford, Gridley, Neosho Rapids, John Redmond Reservoir and Le Roy. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 141 and 145. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
